Articles.Content: Before the forum crash, there was a wonderful black and white delta v map that showed the reqired delta v to land on, orbit, and transfer between all the moons and planets. Does anybody still have it? I feel somewhat helpless without it.
Several of us made copies of it for our own reference. Like so:

Here's a nicer looking one posted on the subreddit recently:

It also has phase angles and sizes.

Edited April 26, 2013 by Holo

Here's a nicer looking one posted on the subreddit recently:

~img snip~

It also has phase angles and sizes.

I love how gilly is only one pixel on the sizes chart.

I love how gilly is only one pixel on the sizes chart.

Gilly is just pointlessly tiny. Just like Deimos!

There's also the one on the wiki, of course.

I like how it looks like a subway system map.
The subway map needs to be updated for Eeloo. Would also be nice to know what constitutes a "low Eeloo orbit"; just thinking about heading out that way (it's in phase in my game at the moment).
Low Eeloo Orbit is at about 40 km.

There's also the one on the wiki, of course.

I like how it looks like a subway system map.

I never understood how to read that one, the numbers don't make sense like they do in the first image posted.
The colorful one is in km/s rather than m/s, and you add all the numbers on the path from where you are to where you want to be. I liked it, and keep wishing it would get updated.

I never understood how to read that one, the numbers don't make sense like they do in the first image posted.

You just add up the numbers between your and your destination. The "subway" map is the one I use, because it gives you the values for the intermediate steps, rather than just taking you to your destination. Sometimes, your goal is other than reaching low orbit or landing on another body.

I'd love to see it updated, but the maker never responded to requests here or on reddit. I guess he's done with KSP. I've dabbled with recreating his visual style a little to update it myself, but rarely have time to even play, let alone work on a play-aid.
